com.foreach.across.modules.webcms.domain.image.connector

Interface WebCmsImageConnector

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    CloudinaryWebCmsImageConnector, ImageServerWebCmsImageConnector

    public interface WebCmsImageConnector
    General API for storing WebCmsImage data (the physical files) in an external repository. This API provides all basic methods that the administration UI needs to upload images, delete images, and building a simple URL to an image.
    Since:
    0.0.2
    Author:
    Arne Vandamme
    See Also:
    CloudinaryWebCmsImageConnector, ImageServerWebCmsImageConnector

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int ORIGINAL_HEIGHT 
      static int ORIGINAL_WIDTH

    • Method Detail

      • saveImageData

        boolean saveImageData(WebCmsImage image,
                      byte[] data)
        Associates physical image data with a WebCmsImage. Usually uploads the physical file to some kind of remote repository, and stores the returned reference using WebCmsImage.setExternalId(String).
        Parameters:
        image - record
        data - actual image file
        Returns:
        true if saving was successful

      • buildImageUrl

        String buildImageUrl(WebCmsImage image,
                     int boxWidth,
                     int boxHeight)
        Builds a URL to render the given image. The box width and height parameters indicate a box in which the image is supposed to fit.

        This method is expected to always return images according to their original aspect ratio.

        Parameters:
        image - to render
        boxWidth - width of the box the image should fit in
        boxHeight - height of the box the image should fit in
        Returns:
        url to the image

      • deleteImageData

        boolean deleteImageData(WebCmsImage image)
        Removes the physical data associated with a WebCmsImage. Usually calls the remote repository to delete the actual image file.
        Parameters:
        image - to remove the physical data from
        Returns:
        true if data has been deleted
